answers.answer: Schedule your MRI today. The worst part is not knowing. Having a diagnosis is such a relief. I thought when my doctor said I could have a pituitary tumor she was crazy. I put it off and put it off. Fast forward three months and I am going back to work after having surgery to get it removed. I only wish I went sooner.
Hi Holly, thanks for the response. I have scheduled an MRI but could take months sadly. What sort of symptoms were you having? And is there a special dye used to look for pituitary??

What does blood testing show?Non-secreting tumors are typically large. A pituitary MRI is called a dynamic MRI and should be ordered by a pituitary endo. Not every place can do it as it requires skill. It is simply a technique that requires the uptake of the contrast to be recorded. But it can be messed up.Have you seen your PCP? Puffy usually mean a fluid imbalance - are you drinking enough?

I am drinking lots of fluids as another symptom I have is excessive thirst. My blood tests were in the normal range but was told non secreting tumours won't show anything in blood tests. I can't imagine waiting months for a possible diagnosis when I am already so low functioning. I don't know what to do or what else could be wrong.

The excessive thirst and peeing is called diabetes insipidus caused by ADH being off. It can also be regular diabetes (sugar diabetes).I waited over 12 years for my diagnosis... It is sadly not uncommon to wait years or even decades for a diagnosis.So, you really need to get accurate testing (proper time, good lab, good doctor to interpret) to know what is going on if you suspect endocrine issues.

Thank you rumpled for your help. 12 years?! Sorry to hear that..that is just wrong. What finally gave you the diagnosis? I am seeing a neurologist for the first time on Feb 13th. I don't know what tests or questions to ask of him. If it isn't pituitary is there something else that causes similar symptoms?

I finally saw an expert who knew what he was doing.A neurologist does not diagnose or treat pituitary disorders. You need to see an endocrinologist at first then a neuro-endocrinologist. A neuro-endo will not see you until you have at least some baseline studies that show you have a tumor or good evidence of a tumor.The symptoms are really all over the place - so it can be an auto-immune disorder, other hormones or other things. You really need decent, accurate testing.
Thanks again Rumpled. I will ask for a referral for an endo I am unsure why they have only referred me to the neuro so far.I do hope to get this resolved soon and get back to life.

In my experience (as a patient) I have found that pituitary tumors are very poorly understood, poorly treated by doctors who don't understand them and then often ignored when they really do need treatment.They often see the size as the factor to disregard them, but size does not matter in most pituitary tumors.

I agree with you and I have only been playing this game for 6 months.My dr told me I can't have a pituitary issue due to my blood levels being ok..I then brought up non functioning tumours or an enlargement and she changed the subject(my guess she had no knowledge). My best hope is for my neurologist to refer me to an endo. I don't know how you did this for 12 years it feels like my lifes falling apart

If they don't test right, order the correct testing or test at the right time it can be normal too - or even interpret the test correctly.I had times when I tried, then tried OTC herbs and stuff to self treat, then gave up completely (oddly, gee, got way way worse), tried again, gave up... found an idiot who gave me the name of disease I had (Cushing's) but tested me totally incorrectly and put it in writing I did not have it... lol... but by then I had a name and started to massively doc shop and finally got it, and just in time because my body was about done. I look back at those pics and wonder how I saw a doc just a few months before diagnosis who said I was just fine... fine... I looked... horrific!I know so many of us in same boat- and somehow we do it.

question: Hi everyone. I am a 22 year old female. I have been unable to work or drive since October due to being so sick. I lose my vision when I turn my head certain ways,low energy, constant headache, I am pale and my face is puffy. I know I need an MRI but have been waiting a while to get one.The last blood test I had a month ago was ok but I do know some tumours don't secrete hormones.I'm afraid the mri might not pick up on the tumour because I have read that you need a special protocol for pituitary. I have read so many stories where the tumour was missed. I am getting more sick and missing out on being young. Do any of you have any advice? Anything is much appreciated, support from those who understand means a lot.
title: Possible pituitary tumour?Any comments appreciated
